dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPER: April 27, 1973 All is quiet outside this suburban school on a sunny Friday afternoon. Cars idle in the driveway awaiting the three o'clock onslaught of liberated children. Two faded yellow buses stand ready. The lull is shattered by the CLANGING of the final BELL. A swarm of children pours out the door and down the broad front steps, scattering across the lawn toward the cars and the buses. Moving slowly through the crowd, ROBIN and ALEX HAMMOND, nine-year-old identical twins, appear at the doorway.. Attractive, dark-haired children, they seem more sub- dued than the others. As they walk quietly down the stairs, Robin lags behind, staring at a boy teasing a girl nearby. He is NICK MCBRIDE, eleven years old, two grades ahead of Robin and the most popular boy in school. The pretty girl laughing at his antics is KIM HAMMOND, also eleven, Robin's older sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Robin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: W-w-where's D-d-daddy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got a meeting at the high school. We're supposed to walk home with Kim... (sees Robin watching the young couple) She's too busy. Let's go by ourselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: N-n-n-no, Alex. Let's w-w-wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? Robin is staring at Nick. Alex looks, understands. He's angry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're crazy, I'm not waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He strides away. Robin's eyes remain on Nick and Kim. Nick says something to Kurt. She shakes her head and pains toward Robin. Robin quickly turns away as they look at her.. When she glances back, Ki_m is walking towards her and Nick is bicycling away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, let's go. The sisters start to walk across the lawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y-you 1-1-like him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y-you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick? Oh, he's all right, I guess. They walk on in silence with Robin stealing glances at her big sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are y-y-you g-gonna m-in-marry him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin? Robin smiles and takes Kim's hand. They walk along the road, kicking rocks and swinging their bookbags. Sud- denly Kim halts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, damn! Robin looks up in surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debbie was gonna lend me her new record. Look, you go on home by yourself. Tell Mom I'll be a little late. Before Robin can reply, Kim is hurrying away.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Robin watches her go, then moves off alone, breaking into a skip and playing imaginary hopscotch. As she turns off the main road into a side street, Robin passes a construction site. The empty skeleton of a half-finished apartment building looms up above the dark shade trees. Hearing VOICES, Robin stops to investigate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex? The VOICES continue. Robin moves closer, peering through the tall bushes surrounding the lot. She sees Nick playing in.the framework with three of his classmates. Robin recognizes JUDE CUNNINGHAM, and KELLY LYNCH as Kim's two best friends. The fourth child, WENDY RICHARDS, is a dark-haired girl, domin- eering and loud. As Robin watches, Wendy jumps up onto the floor of the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to play 'Murder.' Who's the killer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You, Wendy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: you, Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Nick!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll never catch me. Hide your eyes, killer! As Nick turns his back, hiding his eyes against an ex- posed beam, the children scatter through the structure. Robin watches with mounting excitement as Nick finishes counting, and whirls around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The killer is coming for you! He moves into the building, chanting "Kill, kill.," in a low monotone. As he disappears from view, Robin cau- tiously edges out of the bushes and moves up to the building. NICK (O.S. The killer strikes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin hears Jude's SQUEAL of LAUGHTER. Nick has caught her. Immediately Jude's VOICE TAKES UP the "kill" chant in unison with Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin climbs up onto the floor and peers into the dark, gloomy structure. Suddenly, she hears a SHRIEK. Ter- rified, she backs against a wall. LAUGHTER FOLLOWS im- mediately and Robin hears Kelly's VOICE TAKING UP the chant. As the three "killers" move through the vast structure searching for Wendy, "KILL, KILT" ECHOES off the walls and hardwood floors. Robin cautiously steps out of the doorway into the im- mense unfinished lobby. Ominous shadows slash across the floor as the excited girl listens to the relentless CHANTING of the children. Robin pushes on a makeshift wooden door. It slips off its temporary hinges, crashing down to the floor. The NOISE is like a rifle shot; suddenly, there is ABSOLUTE SILENCE in the structure. Petrified, Robin crouches behind a wall, waiting. The CHANTING quickly RESUMES and she breathes a long sigh of relief. Robin moves through a dark corridor, hugging the walls. Flushed with excitement, she imagines herself a "killer" searching for Wendy. As she moves past an empty room, she hears a SOFT GIGGLE. Robin stops and listens care- fully. Once again she hears the GIGGLE, LOUDER this time, coming from nearby. Stepping to a doorway, she leans around the corner and peers inside. In the darkness she can see nothing. Gathering her courage, she quietly slips into the room. The room appears empty but a closet door is slightly ajar. As Robin approaches, she hears a FAINT GASP from behind her. Whirling around, she sees Wendy crouched behind a cardboard box in the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better not tell! Before Robin can react, she hears a THUD from above. Looking up, she sees Nick's head appear through an opening in the ceiling. Seeing Robin, then Wendy standing in the corner, he howls in triumph.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, killers, here! Nick's head disappears from the opening and Robin hears the POUNDING of RUNNING FEET.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you've done it, you idiot! The CHANTING GROWS LOUDER as the "killers" rush towards the room. Trapped, Wendy looks frantically for an es- cape but finds nothing. Turning around suddenly, she grins at Robin, a cruel, hard expression on her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill, kill, kill... Picking up the chant, Wendy begins to advance on Robin. Terrified, Robin turns and rushes out of the room, bowling over Nick in the doorway. Delighted that the game is continuing with a new victim, he follows Wendy in pursuit of Robin. Robin flees down the long, dark corridor, "KILL, KILL ECHOING in her wake. As she rounds a corner, Jude ap- pears, looming up in front of her. Robin screams and sprints in the opposite direction. Kelly leaps out of a doorway and grabs for her, but Robin, swinging out blindly, escapes the "killer."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darting into the large room, Robin collapses against a wall, gasping for breath. As her eyes adjusts to the darkness, she spies a rickety ladder extending through a hole in the floor to the basement below. Stacked up- right near the opening are several sheets of window glass. Before Robin can make a move towards the lad- der, she hears a horrible SCREECH and Wendy appears in the doorway, a vicious look on her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Killers, here! Wendy advances. Terrified, Robin begins to back away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: N-n-n-no!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, Jude and Kelly appear in the doorway, chanting "Kill, kill." Moving quickly, Robin grabs the ladder and starts down into the basement, careful not to knock over the sheets of glass stacked near the opening. Peering into the pitch-black basement, Robin hesitates. But as Wendy and her fellow "killers" close in on her, Robin continues down the ladder. Wendy rushes up and grabs the ladder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: P-p-please! Wendy grins and shakes the ladder. The chanting is deafening. Robin hugs the wooden slats. Wendy shakes even harder. Robin screams. Nick moves around Wendy to get a better look. He accidentally bumps the glass stacked next to the opening. The sudden movement is just enough to dislodge a razor-sharp pane of glass and send it hurtling down directly at Robin. The girl's last scream catches in her throat as the glass slices through her neck. She is instantly decapitated. Horrified, Wendy watches the glass and the body crash to the concrete basement floor. Kelly screams. Jude sobs loudly. Nick can only stare in shock. Finally, he manages to speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta get somebody quick! Nick starts to go. Wendy instantly whirls, grabs his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you crazy? They'll put us in jail! Confused, Nick cannot reply. The other girls grow silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we tell anyone, they'll say it's our fault. Who'd believe it was an accident? Nick starts to protest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me!

dialogues.speaker: WENDY, (C ONT D)
dialogues.text: We'll go home now and never ever tell anyone. They'll think it was an accident. 1,10 one but us will ever know. She looks at each of them. They are still too numb to respond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody swear never to tell! Wendy glares at Jude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jude?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I swear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly? Kelly looks from Wendy to the mangled body and begins to whimper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly! The frightened girl looks up at Wendy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't wanta go to jail...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swear!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I swear. Wendy turns to Nick. At first he appears defiant, ready to object, but he wilts under her withering gaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't tell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a final glance down at Robin's mutiliated body, Wendy quickly ushers her shocked friends out of the room. As their FOOTSTEPS ECHO away across the hardwood floor, there is a terrible silence. Then, starting very quietly, more FOOTSTEPS are HEARD, this time a single person approaching the ladder from above. The FOOT- STEPS STOP and a deep, black shadow falls across the ladder; HEAVY BREATHING punctuates the oppressive quiet, growing louder and more anguished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We slowly TILT UP TO the tortured features of RAYMOND HAMMOND, Robin's father. A handsome, dark-haired man in his late thirties, he teaches history at George Winston High School. Wracked with grief, he stands near the opening in the floor and watches as two Paramedics bring up the body of his daughter from the dark basement. A young Policeman standing nearby raises the white sheet covering Robin's remains. Hammond steps up and gazes at his daughter's decapitated body. A look of absolute horror and revulsion freezes on his face; what he sees he will never forget. Paralyzed, Hammond barely hears the CAR PULLING UP in front of the construction site. He turns and looks out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Police Officer is getting out of his car. Walking around to the passenger side, he opens the door for an attractive blonde woman in her mid-thirties. VIVIAN HANMOND, Robin's mother, appears pale and haggard as she steps out of the car. Kim and Alex slowly climb out of the back, With the Police Officer escorting her, Vivian and her children move toward the skeleton of a building. Catching sight of her husband framed in a lower window, Vivian suddenly breaks. away from the Police Officer and runs inside the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hammond moves quickly to the door, grabbing his hysterical wife as she bursts into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is she? Where is Robin? Seeing the covered figure lying on a stretcher, Vivian moans in anguish. Struggling furiously, she strains to break her hus- band's hold, but he is too powerful.. They are both in tears, shaking with grief, when Kim and Alex step into the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angrily,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you bring them here? Vivian collapses, burying her head in his shoulder and sobbing furiously, but Hammond pushes her out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kim! Alex! Stay out in the hallway! Kim stumbles out into the corridor and begins to cry softly. Alex takes his mother's hand and tries comfort her. The Paramedics pick up the stretcher and maneuver it out of the room. As they pass through the doorway into the corridor, a corner of the sheet slips off Robin's corpse. Before a Paramedic can replace it, the de- capitated torso is briefly glimpsed by the family. Alex is shocked. Kim doesn't appear to realize what she sees. But Vivian's horror wells up in her throat, bursting out in a deranged scream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another SCREAM, as throbbing DISCO MUSIC pulsates from a large portable RADIO sitting on a dresser. SUPER: APRIL 27, 1980. A young woman with long, golden brown hair and a trim figure is slipping into a pair of tight jeans. Pull- ing on a halter top, she sways to the MUSIC.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kim! Turn that music down. You're driving me crazy! Turning around at the SOUND of her mother's VOICE, Kim Hammond reaches for the volume control Now eighteen, she is a strikingly beautiful girl with an open, innocent quality.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Mom! Kim quickly finishes dressing, whirling around the room to the pounding disco rhythm. Giving her hair a few final strokes with a brush, she gazes at a photograph of a young man stuck in her mirror. On the picture is written: "To Kim, the best on the floor... dancing, that is! Love, Nick." Kim glances at another photograph stuck in her mirror. This one shows her sister, Robin, taken a few days be- fore the accident. Her sadness passes as quickly as it came. Gathering her textbooks, she switches OFF the RADIO and exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raymond and Vivian Hammond are just finishing break- fast. The years have favored him; except for a touch of gray around the temples and a few extra pounds, he looks much the same way as we remember him. Vivian, however, wears the strain of the past seven years in her gaunt, drawn features and high-strung manner. Thumbing through his morning newspaper, Hammond steals quick glances at his wife. She does not look up at him, but stares at the table, toying with her spoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading the paper) I'll tell you, Vi, I'm thinking of starting up an armed robbery course at the high school.. I've got a feeling it'd be popular... He smiles at his joke, looks at her. She doesn't seem to have heard him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just hope there's no trouble at the prom tonight... Kim bursts into the kitchen, interrupting her father with a kiss on the head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmmm, sounds like fun!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And how is the next queen of the Winston High Junior-Senior Prom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scared tiff. She leans over to kiss her mother. Vivian automatical- ly turns her cheek to Kim without looking at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning, Mom. We got any yogurt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, dear. Fix yourself a good meal. You're getting awfully thin. Kim and her father exchange glances. He shrugs

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: who's your lucky escort tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, Daddy... Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been trying to forget. The boy's too sure of himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, tell him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seven years ago today. Hammond carefully folds his paper and places it on the table. HAMГЏВїВЅTOND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (affects a casual ATTITUDE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vi, I made you an appointment with Dr. Fairchild. Vivian finally looks up at him. HAMMOND (CONTINUING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's this morning, actually. Sorry I forgot to mention it. VIVIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Today? HAMMOND (LOOKS AWAY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd better get ready. He's fitting you in early before his other... people. VIVIAN (UPSET)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't help. You know that! HAMIOND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, Vi... Vivian stumbles to her feet and rushes out of the kitch- en before he can finish. With a glance at Kim, Hammond hurries after his wife. Going out through the swinging door, he bumps into a young man just entering. HAM4OND (CONTINUING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning, Alex. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: 1J.
dialogues.text: CONTINUED: (3)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hammond exits. Alex, now sixteen, a tall, slender boy, casts a knowing look at Kim. Kim nods. Alex. shakes his head, then begins to rummage through the Pantry, pulling out a Hostess viTikie. ?lopping down at the table, he flips open his electronics book and begins to read. Munching on his Twinkie, he swipes sips from Kim's glass of milk. KIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you got a date for tonight? His mouth crammed.full of Twinkie, Alex mumbles his reply. KIM (CONTINUING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I happen to know Jude might be available. Of course, she is older, but... Alex almost chokes. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Kimbo, I may be hard up... KIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex! Jude's cute... Besides, she's funny and really smart. Give you somebody to do equations with! ALEX (SARCASTIC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great... Anyway, I'm in charge of the sound system tonight. KIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not bad but it's not romance. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll do for tonight. Kim shoots him a look, then backs off. KIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you get a chance, dance with Jude once or twice, okay? ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. He returns her glass of milk, empty. (CONTINUED)     8 CONTINUED: (4) 8 ALEX (CONTINUING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any more milk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hammond and Vivian are standing by the fireplace. His hand is on her shoulder. She faces the mantel, her back to him. On the mantel is a small shrine to the memory oftheir dead daughter; a framed photograph, fresh roses, two candles and a lock of her hair in a glass case. HAMMOND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust me. Vivian does not move. Finally, after a long pause, she turns toward her husband. Her eyes filled with tears, she nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hammond is driving. Vivian stares blankly out the win- dow at the grimy city streets. Sitting in the back, Kim and Alex exchange uncertain glances. A tense si- lence pervades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hammonds' car pulls up in front of a towering modern building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hammond cuts off the engine and turns to Kim and Alex. HAMMOND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll just be a minute... Vivian is already reaching for the door handle,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex jumps out of the car and opens the door for his mother. Taking her arm, he helps her out. Kim leans over in the back seat. KIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you later,'Mom. Vivian gives her a thin smile. Hammond takes her arm and leads her into the imposing building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hammond and Vivian cross the room. Though she offers no resistance, it appears he is pulling her along. They hurry into an elevator after an elderly CLEANING WOMAN carrying a mop and a bucket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stand in silence. The Cleaning Woman puffs on a cigarette, blithely ignoring the NO SMOKING sign posted on the wall. Vivian nervously reaches into her purse and removes a bottle of Valium. Quickly popping two pills into her mouth, she swallows with difficulty and snaps her purse shut. Hammond says nothing. Just as the elevator doors slide open, the Cleaning Wo- man touches Vivian on the shoulder, causing her to jump in fright. CLEANING WOMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could I have one of those? My nerves are shot this morning. With a terrified glance back at the woman, Vivian rushes out of the elevator. Hammond follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hammond and Vivian move down the long, empty hallway. As they round a corner, a figure is visible unlocking a door. HAI` IOND (CALLS OUT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Fairchild! DR. RUPERT FAIRCHILD straightens up and turns around. He's a. portly man in his fifties, trying to disguise his girth with careful tailoring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fairchild bustles about the reception area, turning on lights, checking his messages and appointment calendar. Fairchild is obsessively neat, the office reflects him. HAIIOND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We appreciate your seeing... us. I know how busy you must be. Vivian is staring at a painting of a young girl playing with a kitten. Catching Fairchild's eye, Hammond nods toward the outer door. Vivian does not notice the gesture. (CONTINUED)     17 CONTINUED: 17

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fairchild nods in return. Stepping over to his inner office, he opens the door. FAIRCHILD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a seat, Vivian. I'll be right in. She slowly crosses the room, turning suddenly in the doorway. VIVIAN (TO HAMMOND)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't forget we're going to the cemetery this afternoon. I want Robin to have her flowers. Hammond moves over to his wife. Taking her by the shoulders, he kisses her lightly on the forehead. HAMMOND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't forget. Vivian looks from Hammond to Fairchild, who smiles. She enters the office, leaving the door open. Hammond shakes hands with Fairchild, and for Vivian's benefit adds... HAГЇВїВЅI`i IOND (CONTINUING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Doctor. Hammond exits.

dialogues.speaker: , INT. CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: Hammond leans against the wall outside Fairchild's of- fice. He glances at his watch. The door opens and Fairchild steps out, holding a container. Hammond walks with him down the corridor towards the water fountain.

dialogues.speaker: H.ANMOND
dialogues.text: She's at it again. FAIRCHILD (NODS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Today's the date? HAIM BOND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seven years ago today Robin was killed. Fairchild looks up from filling his container with water. (CONTINUED)
18 CONTINUED: 18

dialogues.speaker: HA,E,10ND
dialogues.text: (CONTINUING; MUSING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This would have been her first prom. FAIRCHILD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pardon? HAKMOND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tonight's the Junior-Senior Prom at our high school. Robin would have been sixteen, She and Alex. FAIRCHILD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The twins... How is Alex? HAIIOND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. I just thank God he was too young to really understand what happened to his sister. FAIRCHILD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And your older daughter? HANMOND (SMILES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimmy's my princess. Sometimes she'll get depressed for a while... but it never lasts long. Young people seem so much more... resilient. They walk back to the office. FAIRCHILD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking up at Hammond) And yourself? No scars? HATIOND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a pause) I've learned to live them.. Vivian seems worse this time. FAIRCHILD (NODS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The persistence of Vivian's trauma. I wonder if there isn't something more serious at work here? HAMOND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something more serious than her daughter's death?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian fidgets in her chair. She seems very small and vulnerable in the large, somber office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex is seated opposite his father in the front seat. Kim is in back. Easy listening MUSIC PLAYS softly on the car RADIO. Alex fiddles with the tuning dial, searching for music more to his tastes. Lost in thought, Hammond does not see the young girl skipping through the pedestrian crossing. KIM (SCREAMS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy! Hammond slams on the brakes, throwing Alex against the dashboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAR SCREECHES to a halt inches away from the terri- fied child who stands frozen in the middle of the crossing. After a moment, realizing she is safe, the girl giggles nervously and skips away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hammond lets out a sigh and turns to his children. HAMMOND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You all right? They both nod. Alex massages his wrist. Hammond slips the car into gear and cautiously continues driving. KIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're worried about Mom? HALMOND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was... He is interrupted by DISCO MUSIC ON the RADIO. Play- ing with the tuning dial, Alex quickly tries to pass over the music. KIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, keep that! Alex groans but does as she asks. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Disco sucks! HAMZMOND (REPROVINGLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex! (CONTINUED)
22 CONTINUED: 22 ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Dad... (turns back to KIM)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Disco bites it! HAMMOND (DRYLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's much better. The car pulls into the Winston High School parking lot. They pile out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hammond, Kim and Alex walk through the empty lot towards the school. Suddenly, we HEAR a loud GRATING SOUND coming from nearby. The sudden noise startles Kim and she huddles against her father. A seedy little middle-aged man with a stubble of gray beard appears from behind a row of bushes, brandishing a pair of electric hedge clippers. HANMMMOND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning, Mr. Sykes. SANFORD SYKES, the newly-hired custodian, bares his yellow teeth in a crooked grin and waves the whirring blades in salute. Kim shudders and stays close to her father as they walk on. KIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's creepy. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard he's wacko. HAIIOND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man is not... wacko. KIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly says he's a pervert, spying on the girls undressing in the locker room. HAIIOND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sykes may have some problems, but he's no Peeping Tom. He's been thoroughly checked out. (CONTINUED)
23 CONTINUED: 23

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They climb the broad front steps of the high school. Hammond glances at his watch. HAMNIOND (CONTINUING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're early today. Plenty of time to study with no one to bother you. Kim reaches up.and kisses her father on the cheek. Pulling out a fashion magazine, she rushes off, call- ing back over her shoulder. KIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'.ve got to decide on my hair style for tonight. HAMMOND (WRYLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wonderful. Alex? ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm building an atomic bomb in shop. Smiling, he moves inside. Hammond shakes his head and hurries off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hammond moves through the empty hallway, stopping at a door which reads: PRINCIPAL: RAYMOND HAMMOND. He is fumbling for his key when he sees through the frosted glass a figure moving around in his office. Reaching for the doorknob, he very quietly opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the door slowly swings open, Hammond sees the outer office covered with pieces of paper; sheets are scattered across desks and chairs and over most of the floor. Stepping inside, Hammond spies a WOMAN bending over, frantically picking up paper from the floor. He slams the door. At the sudden SOUND, the startled Woman whirls around, still squatting, and falls on her rear. HAMMIOND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?
25 CONTINUED: 25

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flustered, the attractive young Woman hastily gets to her feet and straightens her skirt. WOMAN (BADLY FLUSTERED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God! They told me you wouldn't be in till nine! HAMMOND (INCREDULOUS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you doing, robbing me? WOMAN (GIGGLING NERVOUSLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... no, I'm your Working Girl Hammond stares, wide-eyed. WOMAN (CONTINUING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: your temporary secretary. What's-her-name is sick. (extends her hand) Hi. I'm Adele. HAM 0ND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking her hand) What happened? WOMAN (ADELE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well you see, Mr. Hammond, the, air conditioner fan was set for high but... HAP-MOND (INTERRUPTS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, Miss... Adele, ADELE (INTERRUPTS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper... Ms. Cooper. HA MOND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever! I have some important calls to make. Please see that I'm not disturbed... (wades through the papers to his inner OFFICE DOOR)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: , and put all this back where it belongs! He enters his office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hammond tosses his briefcase onto the desk and drops into his chair. He stares at the telephone for a long moment, drumming his finger on the desk. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pink TELEPHONE RINGS. The plush bedroom is empty; suddenly Wendy Richards rushes in. Now eighteen, Wendy is a raven-haired beauty with a full figure, accentua- ted by a low-cut black blouse and tight designer jeans. Tossing her books onto the bed, she eagerly grabs the receiver. WENDY (BREATHLESSLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick? A long pause, followed by HEAVY BREATHING. Wendy is about to respond when the inhuman VOICE speaks in an eerie, androgynous stutter. TELEPHONE VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: W-Wendy? T-t-tonight it's m-m-my t-turn! Wendy's shock quickly turns to anger. WENDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Screw you, Lou! Wendy slams the receiver into its cradle. Grabbing her books, she storms out of her bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wendy hurries do-in the ornate staircase. Waiting at the bottom holding the girl's sweater is MAUDE, the Richards' elderly housekeeper. MAUDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You be home for dinner, Wendy? Wendy angrily grabs her sweater from the woman. WENDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How the hell do I know? She exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The expansive residence sits back off the road in this upper-middle-class suburb. Wendy climbs into her white Mustang and starts the engine. TIRES SQUEALING, she ROARS out of the driveway with the RADIO BLASTING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly Lynch is just finishing breakfast when the TELEPHONE RINGS. The petite blonde eighteen-year-old stuffs a last bite of toast into her mouth and picks up the receiver. KELLY (MUMBLING )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hullo? A pause, then HEAVY BREATHING. Kelly's eyes grow wide as the dreadful voice speaks. TELEPHONE VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: K-K-Kelly? T-tonight it's m-m-ГЇВїВЅIZ Horrified, Kelly drops the phone. The DOORBELL RINGS. Frightened, she gasps, hugging the wall. The DOORBELL RINGS again. Very slowly she moves out of the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly cautiously approaches the front door. Peering through a crack in the drapes, she sees a dark figure huddled near the door. With the latch secured, she takes a deep breath and opens the door. KELLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: DREW, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Christ, Kelly, c'mon! We're late! Relief floods across her face. Kelly quickly unfastens the latch. KELLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Drew, thank God! She throws herself into the arms of the pleasantly sur- prised DREW SHINNICK, a muscular blond athlete. DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding her tightly) I'm glad to see you, too. (CONTINUED)
31 CONTINUED: 31

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks up at him. KELLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drew, this horrible -voice... DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nightmare? KELLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the telephone. It sounded so evil! DREW (LAUGHING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd you get, a heavy breather? KELLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Worse than that... DREW (INTERRUPTS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turned you on did he? Maybe I should try that! She breaks from his grasp. KELLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'm serious! Drew makes a grab for her but she avoids him, hurries inside. He sighs and leans against the doorjamb to wait. DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So am I.,.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drew is driving, his-arm around Kelly. She still appears shaken by the telephone call. The RADIO is ON. His right hand slowly descends towards her breast. She swats it away. The hand moves to her back, slid- ing down. She leans back, pinning his arm against the seat. The car stops at a light and Drew is instantly on Kelly, biting her neck and kissing her hard on the mouth. She pushes him back. KELLY (ANGRY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought we were late. (CONTINUED)     32 CONTINUED: 32 DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll get there... eventually. KELLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? Drew HONKS the HORN at another driver. DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell, you should be glad. A lot of girls would love to have someone steady like me. His irrepressible right hand starts up her leg. KELLY (MOCK-SWEETLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steady? You mean persistent, don't you, darling? Grabbing his hand, she holds it firmly in her lap, which doesn't bother Drew at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jude Cunningham is leaving her house when the TELE- PHONE RINGS. The chubby, brown-haired girl rushes back into the hallway. A plump, middle-aged woman hurries out of the kitchen, wiping her hands on an apron. MRS. CUNNINGHAM eagerly watches her daughter snap up the receiver. The pause, the HEAVY BREATHING and the strange, terrifying voice. TELEPHONE VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: J-Jude? T-t-tonight it's my-my t-t-turn! A disappointed Jude slowly replaces the receiver. Mrs. Cunningham looks on sympathetically. Still no date? JUDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes her head) Getting closer, though.
33 CONTINUED: 33

dialogues.speaker: MRS. CUNNINGHAM
dialogues.text: A boy? JUDE (SMILES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An obscene call... and not very obscene at that! Mrs. Cunningham starts to say something. JUDE (CONTINUING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Mom, gotta run. Giving her mother a quick peck on the cheek, Jude exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The small house appears almost identical to the other dwellings in this lower-middle-class neighborhood. Jude pulls an apple from her large purse, munching while she walks to the bus stop. A gaudily-painted van pulls up alongside her. The win- dow slowly rolls down and a young curly-haired GUY wearing glasses sticks out his head. GUY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, beautiful, need a lift? Jude continues walking, the van moving slowly alongside her. JUDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thanks. GUY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, I won't bite. Jude chomps down hard on her apple. JUDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So who are you? TheGuy leans further out the window. GUY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seymour Stone but.. He's cut short as the van bounces up onto the sidewalk. Jude shrieks. The flustered boy steers the van quickly back onto the road. (CONTINUED)
34 CONTINUED: 27 GUY (CONTINUING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: but they call me Slick! Jude laughs, almost choking on her apple. JUDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can see why... How old are you, Slick? GUY (SLICK)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Old enough... JUDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've heard about guys like you... running over girls on the sidewalk... SLICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just some girls... If they're good lookin' I give 'em a ride. JUDE (SMILING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you stop that thing? Slick jams on the brakes. The van jerks to a halt. He opens the passenger door. JUDE (CONTINUING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going straight to Winston High, understand? SLICK (NODS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Straight to Winston. She climbs inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The interior is decked out in plush red carpet with a bed in back, a stereo cassette deck, and a small fridge. MUSIC is PLAYING. Jude looks around. JUDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like a cheap motel. SLICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheap?... that's a two hundred dollar waterbed there... Jude turns around for a look. (CONTINUED)     35 CONTINUED: 35 SLICK (CONTINUING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hand me that history book. JUDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think this is the time to study? She grabs the book, gives it to him. He places it on the fold-down table between them, flips it open. The inside is hollowed out into a container. It contains nearly a hundred neatly rolled joints. SLICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Straight to Winston High?

dialogues.speaker: EXT. SCHOOL PARKING LOT DAY
dialogues.text: The van weaves through the parked cars, passing up several vacant spots. It finally SCREECHES to a halt at the far end of the lot near some high bluffs over- looking a lake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The air is thick with smoke. JUDE (COUGHING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How old are you, really? SLICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You won't believe it... (PAUSES FOR DRAMATIC EFFECT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sixteen! JUDE (CONSIDERING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe it. They both break up giggling. SLICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You going to the prom tonight? Jude looks away, embarrassed. JUDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, of course. SLICK (GLUMLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not me. My date got sick. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LV.
dialogues.text: 37 CONTINUED: 37 JUDE (BRIGHTENING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? Well, as a matter of fact.. (THINKING FURIOUSLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My date is uh, not that certain... Something might be happening, he's not sure, you know? SLICK (NODDING SOLEMNLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, right... Jude watches him. He's slow picking up her hint. JUDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I guess we're both maybe not going... SLICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... too bad... He looks at her. SLICK (CONTINUING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you think... JUDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd love to! She kisses him on the cheek. JUDE (CONTINUING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you at eight, same spot! She exits, hurrying across the parking lot as he grins foolishly after her. Suddenly, it dawns on him. SLICK (CALLS OUT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tall rugged-looking man wearing a police uniform stands in ,the center of the room checking over his revolver. He's DARRYL McBRIDE, forty-eight years old and a veteran Sergeant on the Police Force. Satisfied with the condition of the gun, he jams it back into its holster, turns, calls out. (CONTINUED)
38 CONTINUED: MCBRIDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go, son! A handsome dark-haired boy of eighteen emerges from a back room. He's Nick McBride. His father pulls open the front door. MCBRIDE (CONTINUING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a guy who moves so fast around a disco floor, you are the slowest goddamn thing... Nick nods sleepily, yawns. NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, I know... McBride steps out into the hallway. Nick grabs his books and follows. The TELEPHONE RINGS. Nick hesi- tates. Shaking his head he exits, shutting the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TELEPHONE keeps RINGING. McBride looks at his son. MCBRIDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you answer i NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just Wendy. She's pissed off. She wants me to take her to the prom tonight. MCBRIDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you two broke up. The TELEPHONE continues to RING. NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three months ago... you can't tell Wendy anything she doesn't want to hear. MCBRIDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you going with the Hammond girl? The principal's daughter? NICK (SMILES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kim.     39 CONTINUED; 39 MCBRIDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, I wish I had your women problems. They walk down the corridor as the TELEPHONE continues to RING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex is alone in the large room. ROCK MUSIC BOOMS out of two huge SPEAKERS suspended from the ceiling. Alex sits behind a console, flipping switches and turning dials, electronically distorting the music. A wall TELEPHONE RINGS.. Caught up in his own manufac- tured sounds, Alex ignores it. After several more RINGS, he reluctantly leaves the console and answers the phone. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello... what?... He listens, expressionless, then hangs up. He flips a switch on the console and the MUSIC STOPS. He sits there a moment, thinking. Then he turns out the lights and exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kim walks down the long deserted corridor. She hears FOOTSTEPS. She turns. No one. Shaking her head, she continues walking. The FOOTSTEPS return, louder. Kim begins to hurry. She rounds a corner and slips against the wall, waiting. Silence. With a deep breath, she moves on to her locker. Kim quickly twists the dial on the combination lock and yanks open the door. Grabbing several books she slams the door shut. A mop HANDLE CRASHES into the locker, missing her head by inches. The SHARP REPORT echoes down the corridor. Terrified, Kim jumps back, spins around. Sykes is standing there. SYKES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: S-s-sorry, Missy. You hurt? Her heart pounding wildly, Kim rushes into the gym. Sykes picks up his mop.     32-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kim runs into the huge deserted gym, glancing frantical- ly over her shoulder. Her FOOTSTEPS CLATTER across the hardwood floor. She stops, waits to recover her breath. The room glows tgith a crystalline light sparkling off the silver decorations put up for the Prom. Stretched across the bleachers is a banner reading: "DISCO

dialogues.speaker: MADNESS."
dialogues.text: Gazing around, Kim feels the excitement of anticipation. Imagining herself in Nick's arms, she begins to dance, whirling through the gym to the music in her head. Suddenly, someone is clapping, slowly.

dialogues.speaker: WENDY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Bravo... Kim stops abruptly. Standing onstage, watching her, is Wendy. WENDY (CONTINUING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Practicing for tonight? KIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, as a matter of fact... I was just... WENDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thinking about Nick, maybe? KIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my business. WENDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wish! Nick is King of the Prom, you happen to be Queen of the Prom... that's all there is to it, Hammond... As far as anything else... Nick is mine... KIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really ought to tell him that. WENDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm telling you, okay? Stay away from Nick! KIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You and Nick haven't been together in ages. WENDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know nothing about it! (CONTINUED)     _J _J 42 CONTINUED: 42 KIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? So who are you going with tonight? WENDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not who you go with, honey... it's who takes you home. KIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll try and remember that. WENDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait and see, bitch... Just wait and see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The corridor is packed with students -- flirting, gossiping, fighting, a few even studying. We PICK UP Kim and VICKI CANTRELL, eighteen, moving down the crowd- ed hallway through the various conversations. KIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: : So then she threatened me. VICKI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wendy's a jerk!

dialogues.speaker: FIRST MALE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: She didn't!

dialogues.speaker: SECOND MALE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Swear to God!

dialogues.speaker: FIRST MALE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: (INCREDULOUS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the teachers' lounge? OTHER VOICES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dual headers... thinks he's a fox... Dust'll run you... long and slinky and tight... swings like my mother... how much for half a lid? Jude joins Kim and Vicki as they walk. JUDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: guys. KIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jude. (CONTINUED)
43 CONTINUED: 43 VICKI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Missed you on the bus today. JUDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't ride it. VICKI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you were too big to hide. KIM (CHIDING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vicki... JUDE (IGNORING VICKI)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a ride. VICKI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who with? KIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None of your business. JUDE (BLASE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A guy. Vicki and Kim are left hanging, waiting for more. VICKI (FINALLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jude! Jude can hold it back no longer. JUDE (EXPLODES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to the prom! Kim. and Vicki excitedly hug Jude. A big, bushy-haired youth with a stubble of beard strolls by, smirking when he sees the girls embracing. LOU PERANO, a twenty-year- old high school junior, stops and stares. LOU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew there was some reason Kim wouldn't go out with me. She likes girls! The girls separate. (CONTINUED)     43 CONTINUED: (2) 43 VICKI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say goodbye, Lou. KIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Vicki and Jude) Let's go. They head down the hallway to their lockers. Lou tags along. LOU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You girls get bored with each other, I'm always around, you know? They pass Kelly and Drew huddled at her locker. His hands rest on her shoulders. They are talking intently. VICKI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poor girl must be exhausted. Look how he has to hold her up... (sees Nick approaching WITH WENDY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh oh. Kim stops suddenly and turns to look. Lou bumps into her, his hand purposely grazing her rear. KIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go play with yourself, Lou. LOU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm saving it for you. Kim sighs with disgust and turns around as Nick walks up talking to Wendy. NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wendy, for Christ sake, I never... (SEES KIM)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kim! KIM (IGNORING WENDY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Nick. Seeing Kim, Wendy quickly reaches up and kisses Nick on the mouth. WENDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll talk about it later, lover. Bye. Wendy smiles and strolls away. Lou follows her. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: NICK (EMBARRASSED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told her to leave me alone. KIM (NODS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Worked real well. The BELL RINGS signalling first period class. Kim turns to Vicki and Jude. KIM (CONTINUING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'd better go. Kim brushes past Nick without a word. The two girls ex- change puzzled glances and follow her. NICK (WORRIED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kim? Kim does not turn back. Walking next to her, Vicki watches her friend curiously. Kim giggles. A sneaky smile creeps across her face. JUDE (GRINNING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's cruel! KIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh! VICKI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no you don't... (turns back and calls to Nick) She's smiling, Nick. Big grin spread all over her face. Kim punches her friend but the damage is done. Nick grins broadly. Blushing, Kim turns back, flashes him a quick smile and disappears around a corner to the hoots of Vicki and Jude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tall dark figure walks quickly down a concrete cor- ridor. From somewhere nearby, loud VOICES, SPLASHING water, can be HEARD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shadow moves behind the opaque glass plate of a heavy door. (CONTINUED)     45 CONTINUED: 45

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door edges open. Raymond Hammond appears. Prop- ping the door open with his shoulder, he starts down across the narrow gallery to the pool below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A class of senior male students occupies the water, among them Nick McBride and Drew Shinnick. With no Phys. Ed. instructor in sight, it's a general goof-off period. Nick walks out onto the diving board. Drew is treading water below him.

dialogues.speaker: HAMMOND 47
dialogues.text: as he watches Nick intently from the gallery door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick launches himself out over Drew in an apparent belly-flop. At the last moment, he tucks in and hits the water in a flipped over cannonball. He surfaces to a chorus of whistles and cheers. It was a close shave. DREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanta take care of yourself, man... Kim's expecting a lot from you tonight... Nick laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door is easing shut. Hammond is nowhere to be seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A side door opens. Hammond steps in, gazes around. The gym is empty, silent. He walks to the stage steps, climbs up, pushes through the thick curtain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a dark cluttered area broken up by tall partitions, discarded flats from old student productions, banks of lights. Hammond crosses to a rear door, tries it. It's locked. He turns back. As he does so there's a sudden WHIRRING SOUND. A row of spotlights flashes on right in front of him, almost blinding him. He tries to shield his eyes. (CONTINUED)
51 CONTINUED: 51

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He spins around. Another bank of lights flares at him. He staggers downstage. The curtains begin to swing open. Startled, he jumps away from them. His foot lands on a package of photo-flood bulbs.. There's a LOUD POP. Then a VOICE.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Who's there? Hammond, shaken, looks across to the far wing. There's an elevated platform where the electronic control panel is located. Alex peers down. HAMMOND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex?... What the hell're you doing? ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm testing the board... I didn't hear you... nobody's supposed to be here yet... HAMMOND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, well'... He looks around. He's still trying to get himself together. HAMMOND (CONTINUING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm.. I'm thinking we might have a fire hazzard here, all these extra lights. He looks awkward, as if he'd been caught at something. H.A1 ll4OND (CONTINUING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: all right... He turns, climbs down the stage steps and starts back across the gym. At the other end of the floor a door opens, Sykes looks in. Hammond sees him.

dialogues.speaker: HA, MOND
dialogues.text: (CONTINUING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah... Mr. Sykes... Sykes waits as Hammond hurries across to him. The two men go out together. Alex walks out onto the stage, watches them go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First period biology class features MONTY WELLER, a tall, thin Englishman in his late thirties. This stuf- fy, dour science teacher drones on about the joys of ex- ploring frog vertebrae while most of his class naps, daydreams or passes notes. Seated in the back near the door, Jude is furtively opening a handwritten note. She quickly reads it. Stifling a giggle, she looks up to see Kim and Vicki across the aisle, eagerly awaiting her reply. Jude tears out part of a page from her biology book and scrawls her answer. Folding the note, she taps the boy next to her and motions for him to pass it on. Vicki grabs the note from the boy. Quickly scanning it, she nods, impressed. Kim reads it and mouths the word "Wow" to Jude who blushes happily. Glancing out into the hallway, Jude notices Slick walk- ing past. Seeing her in class, he stops and waves. Jude frantically tries to motion him away. Their backs to the door, Kim and Vicki watch with curiosity as Jude gestures in their direction. Seeing her friends watching her, Jude smiles and tries to ignore Slick. Not to be denied, he exaggeratedly mimes Weller, nose to his textbook, lecturing on, oblivious to his class. Jude laughs in spite of herself. Kim and Vicki turn around. Glancing out the door, the two girls stare in disbelief at the small weird curly-haired boy doing a perfect im- itation of the eminently boring Weller. Their surprise turns to hilarity as they realize this boy must be Jude's prom date. Kim holds up the note, raising her eyebrows as she gestures toward Slick. Jude nods. Kim and Vicki can barely contain their laughter. They do not notice Mr. Weller eyeing them suspiciously as he rattles on about frog intestines. Slick mouths the words, "See you at lunch.., in the van." Jude nods and smiles. With a final bow and a wave, he exits. Kim suddenly looks up to find a red-faced Mr. Weller looming above her. WELLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Hammond! Wide-eyed, Kim desperately tries to crush the note in her hand. (CONTINUED)     52 CONTINUED: 52 WELLER (CONTINUING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since you obviously find your own words more interesting than those of Farnsworth on the anatomy of a frog... (pauses to share his wit with the class) , read the note! KIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (barely a whisper) Read the note? WELLER (STERNLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, Miss Hammond! Kim swallows and steals a quick glance at her friends. Vicki winces. Jude tries to disappear beneath her, seat. KIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yessir... (clears her throat) Well, it's mostly talking about... WELLER (INTERRUPTS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Word for word, please. Exactly as it is written. KIM (NODS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.. (coughs and finally begins, slowly, in a STILTED MANNER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a hunk! Titters from the class. KIM (CONTINUING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really cute... Tall... a great BODY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The class roars with laughter. KIM (CONTINUING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kinda the Latin lover type. (MORE) (CONTINUED)     41- 52 CONTINUED (2) 52

dialogues.speaker: KIM, (CONS'' D)
dialogues.text: (reading ahead, KIM GIGGLES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and his name is Slick! The classroom erupts into laughter as the BELL RINGS, signaling the end of the class. Still laughing, stu- dents gather their books and shuffle out, several giv- ing Kim sympathetic glances as they pass. WELLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After school, Miss Hammond. One hour detention study hall... you and your friends! Kim looks from Jude to Vicki. KIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, Mr. Weller, tonight's the prom... WELLER (DISDAINFULLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell that to your... (SNIFFS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: hunk! He spins on his heel and marches back to his desk. The three girls hurriedly exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hand is flipping through the pages of the Winston High yearbook, the back pages where the individual photographs of graduating students are placed. The hand stops, moves across an open page to a smiling head shot of Nick McBride. The hand rips the picture from the page, sets it down on a plain wooden desk alongside three other pictures -with similar torn edges. The other pictures are of Jude Cunningham, Kelly Lynch, and Wendy Richards. The yearbook is slammed shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kim, Jude and Vicki enter the crowded room. MUSIC from several portable RADIOS can be HEARD above the clamor as the girls move into the long lunch line. Kim spots Alex seated nearby and waves to him. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: 4L.
dialogues.text: 54 CONTINUED: 54 VICKI (NUDGING JUDE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here comes the incredible hunk himself. Jude looks up to see Slick slowly making his way down the line towards them. He is carrying a tray piled high with snack food: potato chips, cookies, candy. Jude smiles as he passes her, grinning. KIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like a party. JUDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah -- I don't think he's gonna be too good for my diet... Slick moves down the lunch line. Suddenly he is bumped from behind, sending the tray and the snacks flying across the room. Looking around, Slick jumps back, startled by a tall figure wearing a dark ski mask. SLICK (ANGRILY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, clown, what the... Three of Lou's gang quickly step up behind the masked figure. LOU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say what? SLICK (SHRUGS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it, Lou. LOU (SMIRKS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I figured. Slick bends over to pick up his lunch. SLICK (SOFTLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asshole! Lou and his friends shove ahead in the line until he is standing behind Kim. Lou nuzzles Kim's neck. LOU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (muffled by the mask) Like me better now? (CONTINUED)
54 CONTINUED: (2) 54

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Startled, Kim spins around. Her fear quickly becomes anger. KIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's an improvement! She turns her back to him. LOU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like it so much... (spins her around to FACE HIM)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a taste. He kisses her hard on the mouth. Swinging at him, Kim breaks away. Laughing, Lou grabs her wrists and rough- ly pulls her to him. Alex instantly jumps to his feet. LOU (CONTINUING;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: holding Kim close) Be nice... Alex leaps over the metal railing separating the line from the tables. Crashing into Lou, he drives the larger boy back into the salad counter, sending food and utensils flying. As they tumble off the counter onto the floor, Alex gets in several furious punches before Lou's gang can pry him loose. Two of the gang pin Alex against the counter. Wiping blood from his mouth, Lou grins maliciously and slugs Alex in the stomach. The boy groans and doubles over. Lou grabs Alex's hair and slams his head back against the glass shield of the counter. As Lou rears back to throw another punch, his two friends suddenly release Alex and scatter. The boy crumples to the floor. Lou turns around to see two MALE TEACHERS rapidly approaching. The larger teacher grabs Lou. TEACHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This time you're out, Perano. Lou points to Alex who is being helped up from the floor. LOU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He started i TEACHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll bet... Alex? (CONTINUED)     54 CONTINUED: (3) 54

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex nods, leaning on the other teacher for support. KIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not true! Alex was trying to help me. The teacher looks from Kim to Lou to Alex. TEACHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd better come along to your father's office. LOU (SNEERS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wonder who'll get off with just a warning? Several students laugh. The two Teachers march Lou and Alex through the silent cafeteria. Lou swaggers bask- ing in the attention. Alex walks with his head bowed. They exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lou and Alex accompany the teachers down the corridor toward the principal's office. Nick and Wendy approach from the opposite direction, talking heatedly. NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care who. Just somebody else! WENDY (BITTER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never had it so good as with me. NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got it now... better! WENDY (ANGRILY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't even know... (spots Lou and CALLS OUT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lou! The surprised Lou tries to stop but the Teachers hurry him and Alex past the couple. Wendy watches Nick. LOU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning back to Wendy) I got this appointment. (CONTINUED)
55 CONTINUED: 55 WENDY I'LL WAI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wendy turns to see Nick's reaction but he is already walking towards the cafeteria. The irate girl glares after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hammond is talking on the telephone. He appears agi- tated, running his fingers through his hair and tugging at the knot in his loosened tie. HAMMOND (EXASPERATED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Vi. I didn't forget. I told you we'd go to the cemetery... The door opens and Adele Cooper's head peers around the corner. Seeing Hammond talking on the phone, she nods toward the outer office. Hammond gestures for her to wait. She persists until he angrily takes the receiver from his ear and covers the mouthpiece. HAMMOND (CONTINUING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it? ADELE (WHISPERING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are some gentlemen here to see you, Mr. Hammond. HAMMOND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't it wait? ADELE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't ask... But one looks a little like that child in the picture on your desk. Hammond automatically glances at the photograph of Robin framed alongside one of the rest of his family. HAMMOND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into the receiver) I've got to go now, Vi... We'll be there within the hour... There's a loud CLICK on the other end of the line. HAIIOND (CONTINUING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn! (CONTINUED)
56 CONTINUED: 56

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frustrated, Hammond slams the receiver into its cradle. HAMMOND (CONTINUING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, send them in. The two Male Teachers enter first, followed by Lou and finally Alex. Hammond gives his son a sharp look, then turns to glare at Lou. HAMMOND (CONTINUING ;WEARILY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You again? TEACHER (NODS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brawling in the cafeteria... both of them. He places Lou's ski mask on Hammond's desk. The prin- cipal glances at it. HAMMOND (FINALLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. I'll handle it. The Teachers exit. HAMMOND (CONTINUING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Explanations? He looks at Alex. The boy stares at the floor and says nothing. Hammond holds the mask up to Lou. HAIIOND (CONTINUING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halloween? LOU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just foolin' around with this girl... ALEX (INTERRUPTS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kim! Hammond frowns. LOU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: when this -- your son tackled me and... HAMMOND (INTERRUPTS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this true, Alex? (CONTINUED)
56 CONTINUED: (2) 56 LOU (SNIDE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew It ! Hammond whirls on him. HAMMOND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You knew what? LOU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It just figures. HAIV MOND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (his voice rising WITH ANGER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That I'll play favorites? That I'll go easy on Alex because he's my son? (pauses, waiting for Lou to back down and LOOK AWAY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn right I will! You're a disgrace to this school and this community... (RECOVERS SOMEWHAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're suspended -- indefinitely! Now get out! LOU (SNEERS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about your son? HAMMOND (ICILY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're not off school grounds in five minutes, I'll have you arrested for trespassing. Lou stalks to the door. Opening it, he turns to Alex. LOU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you around. He exits, slamming the door. HAMMOND (WITHOUT LOOKING AT ALEX)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have the nurse take a look at you, then get back here. Alex exits. Hammond angrily grabs Lou's ski mask and hurls it at the trash can_

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kim and Vicki are sprawled on the grass eating lunch. Lou storms down the front steps. Pausing at the bottom, he turns, strolls over to Kim. LOU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch for me, little girl. You know I'm just a kiss away. Lou laughs and walks off toward the parking lot. Kim shudders. Wendy's white Mustang slides up to the curb. The pass- enger window rolls down and Lou leans over to look in- side. After a moment he climbs in and the MUSTANG PEELS out of the lot, leaving twin black tread marks in its wake. KIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a pair! VICKI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Made for each other! Kim opens a carton of yogurt. KIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wearing that green gown tonight? VICKI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You kidding? That was last year. This year... red silk! (smiles and runs her hand from her neck to her waist) Cut to here! ...

dialogues.speaker: NICK, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Cut to where? Kim and Vicki turn to see Nick ambling across the lawn toward them. VICKI (MOCK-SEDUCTIVELY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anywhere you like... KIM (SMILING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the prowl!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wendy's white Mustang streaks through traffic, dodging in and out of lanes, running yellows, burning around corners.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lou sits pinned to the passenger seat, eyes wide, staring straight ahead as if he can't quite believe this trip. His bravado seems to have left him. He glances over at Wendy in the driver's seat. She's puffing on a cigarette, handling the wheel almost casually. She's in control,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mustang suddenly slows down and makes a hard left turn, narrowly beating a horn-honking oncoming van. The big white car bounces up over the curb and sweeps into the end slot at a sprawling fast-food drive-in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lou's still pinned to his seat. Wendy shuts off the engine, looks at him. He looks at her, lets out a long deep breath. A cute little CAR-HOP in a cut-off costume and roller skates glides over. She leans into Wendy's window, talks through a wad of gum. CAR-HOP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready to order? WENDY (TO LOU)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want? Lou's shifting around in his seat, pulling himself together. LOU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm uh... a little short on cash.. WENDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can owe me. LOU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? Okay then, a couple of burgers, a large fries... what kind of beer you got? CAR- HOP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon man, this is a drive-in not a bar. LOU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, all right... don't get nervous... Gimme a coke... (MORE) (CONTINUED)
61 CONTINUED: LOU (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods to Wendy) She'll have the same. WENDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small diet cola. WENDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That ' sit. The Car-hop shrugs, wheels away. Wendy turns to Lou. WENDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll buy you one for Christmas, all right? Now, how do I know you're serious? LOU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatta you mean, serious? I hate that school, Hammond and his asshole family... WENDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want anyone hurt... not badly. LOU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got it... anything your little heart desires... WENDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lou, shouldn't we go over this. Lou puts his finger to her mouth, silencing her. LOU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take care of it, Scout's honor... Don't worry about it... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Di. 61 CONTINUED: (2) 61

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He caresses her cheek and lips, then kisses her. At first reluctant, Wendy quickly takes over. When they finally break from their passionate clinch, he is gasping. LOU (CONTINUING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ! WENDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about it.. She unbuttons his shirt and begins to kiss and lick his chest. Slowly she works her way down. Lou begins to writhe. Wendy's head disappears from VIEW. Lou's eyes snap open in surprise. Wendy groans. WEND Y

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn stick shift! Lou starts to protest, then dissolves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Car-hop wheels up to the Mustang carrying a tray loaded with food. She leans over and peers inside. Wendy is behind the wheel, perfectly composed. A mind- blown Lou is hurriedly doing up his belt, tucking in his shirt. He glances at the Car-hop then turns away to finish the job. CAR-HOP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enjoy your meal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WIDE VIEW; high weather-worn bluffs tumbling down to a strip of beach and the calm blue waters of the lake. Above the bluffs there's a narrow shaded park and then the buildings and parking lots of Winston High.     63 CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick and Kim walk slowly along the rim of the bluffs. Nick has his arm around her. She leans into him. KIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am excited, it's just... in some ways it's such an awful day... It's Robin's day...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mother's all upset, as usual. My father too... he doesn't show it so much... It's hard to get over something like that. Robin would have been a junior, like Alex. This would've been her first prom... I guess that's'why it seems so much worse this year... She stops, turns and faces Nick. It's hard for him to meet her gaze. KIM (CONTINUING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Queen of the Prom is determined not to let it get to her... She must maintain her... whatever, at all costs.. She tries a weak smile. Nick stares at her, then sud- denly takes her, pulls her to him, embraces her. She's caught by surprise, but she responds. She smiles. KIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Di. 64 CONTINUED: 64 NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm... I want you to know that... Robin's death... I remember it and I've always been... so sorry about it... Kim looks puzzled. NICK (CONTINUING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean... I know what you're feeling... I've... (looks at her) :Listen I... Across the school parking lot a CAR HORN BLARES, inter- rupts Nick. Kim reacts. KIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my father... I've got to go, Okay? NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... I'll see you later. She hesitates a moment, then kisses him quickly, turns and goes. Nick looks shaken up. He stares after her as she hurries away. Behind Nick, in the other corner of the parking lot, a metal door slides open, loud RAUNCHY ROCK and ROLL sud- denly infests the air. Nick turns, sees Jude climbing out of Slick's van. Jude looks about as stoned as she can get. She spots Nick, waves. JUDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Nick! Nick turns and heads the other way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a small marble headstone inset with the carved face of an angel and the inscription "Robin Anne Hammond 1964 - 1973 Too Soon Taken From Us." Kneeling beside the grave is Vivian Hammond. She's ar- ranging a large bouquet of mixed flowers, fussing with them, trying for some kind of impossible perfection. HP`ГЇВїВЅMOND (0. S. We have to go, Vi. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: J4.
dialogues.text: 65 CONTINUED: 65

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't react, she keeps playing with the flowers. Hammond moves in behind her, puts his hands on her shoulders. She looks at him. HAMMOND (CONTINUING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to get back. She stands, with her husband's support. Kim and Alex are standing quietly at the foot of the grave. Vivian looks at them both. Her eyes hold a terrible rage, a terrible sadness. Hammond carefully guides her away. Kim has a flower of her own, a white rose, which she drops on her sister's grave. She turns, meets Alex's stare, moves off after her parents. Alex remains a mo- ment longer, then. he, too, goes.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. TENNIS COURTS DAY
dialogues.text: During the afternoon phys. ed. class, the girls play tennis: Kim with Kelly and Vicki with Jude. Sykes lingers nearby, watching the girls. Their instructor is Miss HENRI-ANNE BENTON, a stocky woman in her late thirties with teased, lacquered hair. A product of genteel Southern womanhood, Henri-Anne stalks the courts in her baggy Bermuda shorts, constantly blowing a silver whistle hanging from her neck. A very stoned, giggling Jude runs Vicki ragged, hitting balls over the fence, straight up in the air and occa- sionally even back over her head. Each time a ball flies over the fence, Vicki runs to retrieve it to the delight of Sykes. At one point, Vicki bends over to pick up a ball under Sykes' appreciative gaze. The shrill WHISTLE inter- rupts her as Henri-Anne rushes over. HENRI-ANNE (SOUTHERN ACCENT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, Miss Cantrell! Never bend from the waist... Squat! (DEMONSTRATES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Always squat to retrieve. Otherwise, you look like the broad side of a barn! (glares at Sykes) Isn't that so, Mr. Sykes? Embarrassed, the custodian scuttles away to the girls' Laughter.     66 CONTINUED: 66 HENRI-ANNE (CONTINUING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's enough for today, ladies. We don't want you all worn out for the ball tonight. Kim, Jude and Kelly gather'around with the other girls. JUDE (GIGGLING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ball? KIM
